ca.uqac.lif.cep.functions

Class BinaryFunction<T,V,U>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.functions.Function
      • ca.uqac.lif.cep.functions.SimpleFunction
        • ca.uqac.lif.cep.functions.BinaryFunction<T,V,U>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the first input
    V - The type of the second input
    U - The type of the output
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contextualizable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Addition, Division, Equals, IsGreaterOrEqual, IsGreaterThan, IsLessThan, Multiplication, Power, Subtraction

    public abstract class BinaryFunction<T,V,U>
extends SimpleFunction
    Function of two inputs and one output

      • compute

        public Object[] compute(Object[] inputs)
        Description copied from class: SimpleFunction
        Computes the outputs of the function, given some inputs
        Specified by:
        compute in class SimpleFunction
        Parameters:
        inputs - The arguments of the function. The size of the array should be equal to the function's declared input arity.
        Returns:
        The outputs of the function. The size of the array returned should be equal to the function's declared output arity.

      • getOutputArity

        public final int getOutputArity()
        Description copied from class: Function
        Gets the function's output arity, i.e. the number of elements it outputs. (We expect that most functions will have an output arity of 1.)
        Specified by:
        getOutputArity in class Function
        Returns:
        The output arity

      • getStartValue

        public U getStartValue()
        Gets a reasonable starting value if this function is used to create a CumulativeFunction. You only need to override this method if the function is expected to be used in a cumulative function; otherwise returning null is fine.
        Returns:
        A start value

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: Function
        Resets the function to its initial state. In the case of a stateless function, nothing requires to be done.
        Specified by:
        reset in class Function
